labelById.307378: 2: The Influence of Language and Culture on Identity
labelById.307380: 4: How Science and Technology Affect Our Lives
labelById.307381: 5: Factors That Affect the Quality of Life
labelById.307215: Skill Category 1: Comprehend written, audio, audiovisual, and visual text (text, pictures, and numbers).
labelById.307216: Skill 1.A: Describe the literal meaning of the text.
labelById.307219: 1.A.3: Retell or summarize information in narrative form.
labelById.307222: 1.B.1: Identify and describe patterns and trends in data.
labelById.307223: 1.B.2: Describe data from a table, chart, graph, map, or infographic.
labelById.307224: Skill Category 2: Make interdisciplinary and cultural connections.
labelById.307226: 2.A.1: Identify and/or describe content and connections among cultural topics.
labelById.307227: 2.A.2: Explain how data from a graph or table illustrate cultural topics or phenomena.
labelById.307228: 2.A.3: Explain how information from a text connects or relates to the target cultural topics or phenomena.
labelById.307229: 2.A.4: Infer cultural information from a text.
labelById.307230: Skill 2.B: Make connections in and across disciplines.
labelById.307231: 2.B.1: Identify and/or describe content and connections among interdisciplinary topics.
labelById.307232: 2.B.2: Explain how data from a graph or table illustrate interdisciplinary topics or phenomena.
labelById.307233: 2.B.3: Explain how information from a text connects or relates to interdisciplinary topics or phenomena.
labelById.307234: 2.B.4: Infer interdisciplinary information from a text.
labelById.307235: Skill Category 3: Interpret the content of written or audio text (words).
labelById.307236: Skill 3.A: Interpret the distinguishing features of a text.
labelById.307239: 3.A.3: Identify and/or describe the point(s) of view, perspective(s), tone or attitude.
labelById.307240: 3.A.4: Identify organizing and/or rhetorical structures and/or strategies.
labelById.307241: Skill 3.B: Interpret the meaning of a text.
labelById.307242: 3.B.1: Identify and/or describe similarities and/or differences among different types of texts.
labelById.307244: Skill Category 4: Make meanings from words and expressions.
labelById.307245: Skill 4.A: Determine the meaning of familiar and unfamiliar words.
labelById.307246: 4.A.1: Determine the meaning of a variety of vocabulary.
labelById.307247: 4.A.2: Deduce the meaning of unfamiliar words or expressions.
labelById.307248: Skill 4.B: Use words appropriate for a given context.
labelById.307249: 4.B.1: Use a variety of vocabulary in written and spoken communication.
labelById.307250: 4.B.2: Explain and use idiomatic and culturally authentic expressions.
labelById.307251: Skill Category 5: Communicate interpersonally by speaking with others.
labelById.307252: Skill 5.A: Understand and apply appropriate communication strategies in interpersonal speaking.
labelById.307253: 5.A.1: Initiate, maintain, and close spoken exchanges.
labelById.307254: 5.A.2: Comprehend a spoken interlocutor's message in spoken exchanges.
labelById.307255: 5.A.3: Provide and obtain relevant information in spoken exchanges.
labelById.307256: 5.A.4: Use appropriate register and greeting for the intended target culture audience in spoken exchanges.
labelById.307257: 5.A.5: Use pronunciation that is comprehensible when interacting with speakers of the target language in spoken exchanges.
labelById.307258: 5.A.6: Use effective intonation patterns, pacing, and delivery when interacting with speakers of the target language in spoken exchanges.
labelById.307259: 5.A.7: Use communication strategies, such as circumlocution, requesting clarification, asking for repetition, and paraphrasing to maintain spoken exchanges.
labelById.307260: Skill 5.B: Understand and apply appropriate and varied syntactical expressions in interpersonal speaking.
labelById.307261: 5.B.1: Use a variety of grammar and syntax in spoken exchanges.
labelById.307262: 5.B.2: Use transitional expressions and cohesive devices in spoken exchanges.
labelById.307263: 5.B.3: Comprehend and produce simple, compound, and complex sentences in a variety of time frames in spoken exchanges.
labelById.307264: 5.B.4: Monitor language production; recognize errors and attempt self-correction in spoken exchanges.
labelById.307265: Skill Category 6: Communicate interpersonally by writing to others.
labelById.307266: Skill 6.A: Understand and apply appropriate communication strategies in interpersonal writing.
labelById.307267: 6.A.1: Initiate, maintain, and close written exchanges.
labelById.307268: 6.A.2: Provide and obtain relevant information in written exchanges.
labelById.307269: 6.A.3: Use a variety of grammar and syntax in written exchanges.
labelById.307270: 6.A.4: Use register appropriate for the intended target culture audience in written exchanges.
labelById.307271: 6.A.5: Use communication strategies, such as circumlocution, requesting clarification, and paraphrasing to maintain written exchanges.
labelById.307272: Skill 6.B: Understand and apply appropriate and varied syntactical expressions in interpersonal writing.
labelById.307273: 6.B.1: Use transitional expressions and cohesive devices to create paragraph length discourse in written exchanges.
labelById.307274: 6.B.2: Comprehend and produce simple, compound, and complex sentences in a variety of time frames in written exchanges.
labelById.307275: 6.B.3: Use standard conventions of the written language (e.g., capitalization, orthography, accents, punctuation) in written exchanges.
labelById.307276: 6.B.4: Monitor language production; recognize errors and attempt self-correction written exchanges.
labelById.307277: Skill Category 7: Communicate through spoken presentations.
labelById.307278: Skill 7.A: Plan and research an issue or topic for presentational speaking.
labelById.307279: 7.A.1: Use a process to plan spoken presentations.
labelById.307280: 7.A.2: Use research strategies to gather information and evidence for inclusion in spoken presentations.
labelById.307281: Skill 7.B: Use appropriate vocal and visual strategies to communicate an idea for presentational speaking.
labelById.307282: 7.B.1: Produce spoken presentations in the appropriate register with an introduction, development of topic, and a conclusion.
labelById.307283: 7.B.2: Use transitional expressions and cohesive devices to create paragraph length discourse in spoken presentations.
labelById.307284: 7.B.3: Use pronunciation in spoken presentations that is comprehensible to speakers of the target language.
labelById.307285: 7.B.4: Use effective intonation patterns, pacing, and delivery in spoken presentations.
labelById.307286: 7.B.5: Use communication strategies, such as circumlocution and paraphrasing to maintain spoken presentations.
labelById.307287: Skill 7.C: Use appropriate language and vocabulary for your audience for presentational speaking.
labelById.307288: 7.C.1: Use a variety of grammar and syntax in spoken presentations.
labelById.307289: 7.C.2: Produce simple, compound, and complex sentences in a variety of time frames in spoken presentations.
labelById.307290: 7.C.3: Monitor language production; recognize errors and attempt self-correction in spoken presentations.
labelById.307291: Skill 7.D: Express a perspective with details and examples to illustrate an opinion or idea presentational speaking.
labelById.307292: 7.D.1: Explain ideas and opinions with examples in spoken presentations.
labelById.307293: 7.D.2: Compare features (including products, practices, and perspectives), of target cultural communities to student's own community in spoken presentations.
labelById.307294: Skill Category 8: Communicate through written presentations.
labelById.307295: Skill 8.A: Plan and research an issue or topic for presentational writing.
labelById.307296: 8.A.1: Use a process to plan written presentations.
labelById.307297: 8.A.2: Use research strategies to gather information and evidence for inclusion in written presentations.
labelById.307298: Skill 8.B: Use appropriate writing strategies to communicate an idea in presentational writing.
labelById.307299: 8.B.1: Produce written presentations in the appropriate register with an introduction, development of topic, and a conclusion.
labelById.307300: 8.B.2: Use communication strategies, such as circumlocution and paraphrasing to maintain written presentations.
labelById.307301: Skill 8.C: Understand and apply appropriate and varied syntactical expressions in presentational writing.
labelById.307302: 8.C.1: Use transitional expressions and cohesive devices to create paragraph length discourse in written presentations.
labelById.307303: 8.C.2: Use a variety of grammar and syntax in written presentations.
labelById.307304: 8.C.3: Produce simple, compound, and complex sentences in a variety of time frames in written presentations.
labelById.307305: 8.C.4: Use standard conventions of the written language (e.g., capitalization, orthography, accents, punctuation) in written presentations.
labelById.307306: 8.C.5: Monitor language production; recognize errors and attempt self-correction in written presentations.
labelById.307307: Skill 8.D: Express a perspective with details and examples to illustrate an opinion or idea for written presentations.
labelById.307308: 8.D.1: Explain ideas and opinions with examples in written presentations.
labelById.307309: 8.D.2: Integrate information from sources and cite them appropriately in written presentations.
